item.title: Experiential Learning: Why It Works—and Why It Belongs in Family Travel
item.description:
Experiential Learning: Why It Works—and Why It Belongs in Family Travel

In the corporate world, experiential learning has become one of the most powerful tools for building strong teams and teaching lessons that actually stick. Instead of sitting in a conference room or listening to another presentation, teams are placed inside an experience—one that requires communication, problem-solving, trust, and leadership.

The results speak for themselves. Companies use experiential learning because it works.

item.title: One More Email
item.description:
They say the days are long, but the years are short

I always heard that phrase… and nodded along.
Now that my wife and I are officially empty nesters, I feel it in a way I never could before.

Looking back, I’m honestly shocked at how fast it all went.

That doesn’t mean it was easy.

There were seasons we weren’t sure we’d survive:

  • sleepless nights with a sick child
  • potty training boys (enough said)
  • the teenage years that tested everyone’s patience and faith

Somehow, by God’s grace, we were blessed with three incredible kids. They are, without question, what I’m most proud of in this life. And if we’re being honest, most of the credit goes to my wife.
